revised_title: Egon Sharpe Pearson: A Pioneering Statistician and Biometrist
tldr: Egon Sharpe Pearson was a prominent statistician and biometrist, known for his work in developing the science of biometry and advancing statistical methods. He was the son of Karl Pearson, a significant figure in the field of biometry, and followed in his father's footsteps by working at University College London. Pearson made significant contributions to the field, including the Neyman-Pearson theory of testing statistical hypotheses, and played a key role in promoting the application of statistical methods to industrial and agricultural research.
